subtitle: A tiny drumbeat in your womb
description: A tiny drumbeat in your womb
title: Month 3
content:
Created by BabyCenter 

Your baby is still small enough to fit into the palm of
your hand. She is growing hair on her head and fine, soft hair all over her
body. On the tips of her fingers she is developing tiny fingerprints. 

Inside
your womb, your baby floats safely in fluid. She is protected from bumps and
kept warm by the fluid. Babies can get hiccups. This feels like a regular drum
beat in your womb, which can last a few minutes. 

You may be feeling less
nauseous now and find you are suddenly hungry. Eat well. Remember to eat a
variety of foods each day. Eat an extra handful of food at each meal. Make
sure your food is safe and fresh, not stale or old. 

You will also gradually
feel less tired and have more energy. The afterbirth or placenta has developed
inside your womb now and this supports your baby. It will be delivered just
after your baby is born. 

You may find that your clothes feel a bit tighter
around your waist and breasts. Your pregnancy will show soon, as a small bump
low down on your tummy. 

Being pregnant makes you less resistant to germs, so
you may get more coughs and colds. Wash your hands with soap and clean, safe
water regularly. It’s the best way to get rid of germs.
